Class TimeSlot

java.lang.Object
AppointmentManagement.TimeSlot
public class TimeSlot extends Object
Represents a time slot for appointments, including its date, start and end time, and availability status.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Enum representing the status of a time slot.

  • Constructor Details

    • TimeSlot

      public TimeSlot(LocalDate date, LocalTime startTime, LocalTime endTime)
      Constructs a TimeSlot object with the specified date, start time, and end time. The default status is set to AVAILABLE.
      Parameters:
      date - The date of the time slot.
      startTime - The start time of the time slot.
      endTime - The end time of the time slot.

  • Method Details

    • getDate

      public LocalDate getDate()
      Retrieves the date of the time slot.
      Returns:
      The date of the time slot.

    • getStartTime

      public LocalTime getStartTime()
      Retrieves the start time of the time slot.
      Returns:
      The start time of the time slot.

    • getEndTime

      public LocalTime getEndTime()
      Retrieves the end time of the time slot.
      Returns:
      The end time of the time slot.

    • getStatus

      public TimeSlot.SlotStatus getStatus()
      Retrieves the current status of the time slot.
      Returns:
      The status of the time slot.

    • setStatus

      public void setStatus(TimeSlot.SlotStatus status)
      Sets the status of the time slot.
      Parameters:
      status - The new status of the time slot (e.g., AVAILABLE, UNAVAILABLE, BOOKED).

    • generateDailySlots

      public static List<TimeSlot> generateDailySlots(LocalDate date)
      Generates a list of 30-minute time slots for a given date. The slots range from 09:00 to 17:00, with lunch slots (13:00 to 13:30) marked as UNAVAILABLE.
      Parameters:
      date - The date for which to generate the time slots.
      Returns:
      A list of generated TimeSlot objects.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the time slot, including its date, start time, end time, and status.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A formatted string representation of the time slot.
